alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Glades; Hendry; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Inland Palm Beach County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Collier, Mainland Monroe, western Miami-Dade, Hendry, Broward and southwestern Palm Beach Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a funnel cloud along a line extending from near Okeelanta to near Holey Land Wildlife Refuge to 8 miles north of Dade-Collier Training Airport to near Flamingo. Movement was west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belle Glade, Clewiston, South Bay, Labelle, Chokoloskee, Northwest Cape Sable, Lake Harbor, Montura, Everglades City, Immokalee, Ave Maria, Plantation Island, Loop Road Ee Center, Carnestown, Belle Glade Camp, Copeland, Wilderness Waterway, Holey Land Wildlife Refuge, Hendry Correctional and Port La Belle. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until these storms pass. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.
